page.title: 18TRANSPORT_OLD AND NEW
page.content: Pontypool is a nodal point,a junction of valleys,canals,roads and until recently railways. The Abergavenny and Blaenafon vales meet here.Consequently the Newport_ Pontnewynydd canal was joined to the Brecon canal,the junction being at Pontymoile.The canal keepers cottage where tolls for navigation were taken is still in existence. From here to Brecon shallow draft boats cruise now for pleasure. Roads from Crumlin,Blaenafon,join the Newport_Shrewsbury trunk road just south of town.Easy access to the M50 to the Midlands, M4 to London and M5 makes this area attractive to industry. Rail communication is by the mainline to the North but at Pontypool there were extensive marshalling yards as it {was }a major railway junction.
